content.description: Students want to determine the impact of soil erosion from the development of new housing. They plan to measure the density of a species of algae growing along the bottom of a river that flows through their town. The town is built in a heavily forested area, but a large area of trees along the river was recently clear-cut to allow for the construction of a new housing development, which has caused exposed soil to wash into the river. The river flows north to south through the town and is still forested both up- and downstream of the town.
content.question: Which of the following is the dependent variable in the study?

choices.label: The tract of land that was clear-cut for the housing development
A tract of land in a heavily forested area outside of town
The density of a species of algae growing along the bottom of the river
The flow rate of the river from north to south

content.answer: The density of a species of algae growing along the bottom of the river

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Identify a research method, design, and/or measure used.
